required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I/II Study of Sunitinib Malate (SU011248) In Patients With Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor (GIST)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Study of Sunitinib Malate (SU011248) In The Treatment of Patients With Malignant Gastrointestinal Stromal Tumor (GIST) Previously Treated by Imatinib Mesylate.

brief_summary.textblock:
Phase I;To investigate the clinically recommended dose of Sunitinib malate (SU011248) following multiple oral dosing in the first cycle (4 consecutive weeks and 2 weeks rest) by reviewing the safety and tolerability.
Phase II;To determine the objective tumor response and the safety of Sunitinib malate (SU011248) at the clinically recommended dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) on Cycle 1 Day 1
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) on Cycle 1 Day 28
Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve (AUC0-24) on Cycle 1 Day 1
Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve (AUC0-24) on Cycle 1 Day 28
Time to First Occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) on Cycle 1 Day 1
Time to First Occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) on Cycle 1 Day 28
Number of Subjects With Clinical Benefit Response (CBR) Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentrations of Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor (VEGF)
Plasma Concentrations of Soluble Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Type 2 Receptors (sVEGFR2)
Plasma Concentrations of Soluble Stem Cell Factor Receptor (sKIT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 14, 28 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 14, 28 of Cycles 2-4
Day 14, 28 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 14, 28 of Cycles 2-4
Day 14, 28 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 14, 28 of Cycles 2-4

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7, 14, 28, 35 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 7, 14, 28, 35 of Cycles 2-4

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 28 of Cycles 2-4

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Disease Controlled Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group
Number of Subjects With Objective Response Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group

From the first dose to Progressive Disease or Death
From the first dose to Progressive Disease, Treatment discontinuation except completion of treatment, or Death due to cancer.
From the first dose to death

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with histologically-confirmed metastatic or unresectable gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST).
- Patients previously treated with imatinib mesylate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have not recovered from the acute toxic effects of previous antineoplastic therapy or treatment with imatinib mesylate.
- Any tumor therapy for gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) discontinued less than 4 weeks prior to starting study treatment. Imatinib mesylate discontinued less than 2 weeks prior to starting therapy.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Evaluate of RTD for Japanese GIST patients

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Phase 1 only included Cycle 1 for subjects enrolled in Phase 1. Phase 2 was comprised of either Cycle 2 and beyond for subjects who were enrolled in Phase 1, or all cycles for newly enrolled subjects. Additional subjects were enrolled to make a total of 30 in the recommended dose level (50-mg).

group.title: SU-011248 25-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 25-mg once daily. Treatment cycles were 6 weeks in duration, consisting of 4 weeks daily SU-011248 administration followed by 2 weeks off treatment. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: The initial dose could be increased to the recommended dose. Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria.

group.title: SU-011248 50-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. Treatment cycles were 6 weeks in duration, consisting of 4 weeks daily SU-011248 administration followed by 2 weeks off treatment. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

group.title: SU-011248 75-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 75-mg once daily. Treatment cycles were 6 weeks in duration, consisting of 4 weeks daily SU-011248 administration followed by 2 weeks off treatment. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: The initial dose could be reduced to the recommended dose. Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria.

participants_list.participants: Three subjects who completed Phase 1 entered Phase 2.
Six subjects who completed Phase 1 entered Phase 2, and 24 subjects were newly enrolled.
Three subjects who completed Phase 1 entered Phase 2.
However, all 3 subjects enrolled were included in analysis (Intent-to treat population).
However, all 30 subjects enrolled were included in analysis(Intent-to treat population).

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender
Region of Enrollment
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measure.description: Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction. Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature, e.g., light house work, office work.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
outcome.description: Dose Limiting Toxicities(DLT) in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1.
outcome.population: DLT analysis population consists of subjects who developed DLT or received 85% of the planned dose. One subject in 75-mg dose group was excluded from DLT analysis population because the subject received less than 85% of the planned dose.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLT)
measure.description: Dose Limiting Toxicities(DLT) in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1.
measure.population: DLT analysis population consists of subjects who developed DLT or received 85% of the planned dose. One subject in 75-mg dose group was excluded from DLT analysis population because the subject received less than 85% of the planned dose.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) on Cycle 1 Day 1
outcome.description: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of SU-011248, its active metabolite SU-012662 and Total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1. The Cmax for total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) was calculated as the mean of the Cmax of total drug from each individual subject (it is not the simple sum of means of Cmax of SU-011248 and SU-012662).
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had at least 1 blood concentration data for Pharmacokinetic analysis.

outcome.title: Changes From Baseline of Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-Fatigue) Questionnaires
outcome.description: Patient-reported outcome: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-Fatigue) questionnaires (version 4A). The questionnaire consists of a 13-item subscale which covers specific fatigue questions. The subject rates the intensity of fatigue and its related symptoms on a five-point scale(0 to 4). High score is indicating low fatigue. The total score of the 13 items was evaluated. Change from Baseline: Score at each observation minus score at baseline
outcome.time_frame: Day 7, 14, 28, 35 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 7, 14, 28, 35 of Cycles 2-4
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication. n= Number of subjects with analyzable data.

group.title: SU-011248 50-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. measure.title: Changes From Baseline of Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-Fatigue) Questionnaires
measure.description: Patient-reported outcome: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-Fatigue) questionnaires (version 4A). The questionnaire consists of a 13-item subscale which covers specific fatigue questions. The subject rates the intensity of fatigue and its related symptoms on a five-point scale(0 to 4). High score is indicating low fatigue. The total score of the 13 items was evaluated. Change from Baseline: Score at each observation minus score at baseline
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication. n= Number of subjects with analyzable data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline of European Quality of Life Questionnaire- 5 Dimensions(EQ-5D) Questionnaires
outcome.description: The EQ-5D questionnaires evaluates 5 dimensions of health. The subjects rates the severity of impairment for each dimensions on a 3-point scale(1 to 3). The digits for five dimensions were combined in a five-digit number describing the respondent's health state. Health states were converted into a weighted health state index. High score is indicating high health. Change from Baseline: weighted health state index at each observation minus weighted health state index at baseline
outcome.time_frame: Day 28 of Cycle 1; Day 1, 28 of Cycles 2-4
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication. n= Number of subjects with analyzable data.

The digits for five dimensions were combined in a five-digit number describing the respondent's health state. Health states were converted into a weighted health state index. High score is indicating high health. Change from Baseline: weighted health state index at each observation minus weighted health state index at baseline
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication. n= Number of subjects with analyzable data.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Disease Controlled Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group
outcome.description: Number of subjects with Disease Controlled is defined as sum of the subjects confirmed with complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD)>= 10 weeks on study according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

class.title: Total number of Subjects with CR+PR+SD>=10weeks

analysis.estimate_desc: The disease control rate, defined as the percentage of subjects confirmed with CR, PR, and SD >=10 weeks on study according to RECIST.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) on Cycle 1 Day 28
outcome.description: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of SU-011248, its active metabolite SU-012662 and Total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1. The Cmax for total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) was calculated as the mean of the Cmax of total drug from each individual subject (it is not the simple sum of means of Cmax of SU-011248 and SU-012662).
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had at least 1 blood concentration data for Pharmacokinetic analysis. 3 subjects in 75mg dose group discontinued before Cycle 1 Day 28, therefore no data presented.

group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. Treatment cycles were 6 weeks in duration, consisting of 4 weeks daily SU-011248 administration followed by 2 weeks off treatment. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) on Cycle 1 Day 28
measure.description: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of SU-011248, its active metabolite SU-012662 and Total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1. The Cmax for total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) was calculated as the mean of the Cmax of total drug from each individual subject (it is not the simple sum of means of Cmax of SU-011248 and SU-012662).
measure.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had at least 1 blood concentration data for Pharmacokinetic analysis. 3 subjects in 75mg dose group discontinued before Cycle 1 Day 28, therefore no data presented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Objective Response Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group
outcome.description: Number of subjects with Objective Response is defined as sum of the subjects confirmed with complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).
outcome.population: ITT population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

Phase 2: Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

measure.population: ITT population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

class.title: Total Number of Subjects with CR+PR

analysis.estimate_desc: The subjects confirmed with complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) is defined as the time from the date of first dose of study treatment to the date of the first documentation of Progressive Disease (PD) or death.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose to Progressive Disease or Death
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: SU-011248 Clearance on Cycle 1 Day 28
outcome.description: SU-011248 Clearance in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1. Clearance was calculated by dividing a SU-011248 dose(mg) by AUC0-24(ngh/mL).
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had at least 1 blood concentration data for Pharmacokinetic analysis. 3 subjects in 75-mg dose group discontinued before Cycle 1 Day 28, therefore no data presented.

outcome.title: Accumulation Ratio (Rac) on Cycle 1 Day 28
outcome.description: Accumulation Ratio (Rac) of SU-011248, its active metabolite SU-012662 and Total drug (SU-011248+SU-012662) on Cycle 1 Day 28 in the subjects enrolled in Phase 1. Rac was the ratio of Day 28 to Day 1.
outcome.population: All enrolled subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication and who had at least 1 blood concentration data for Pharmacokinetic analysis. 3 subjects in 75-mg dose group discontinued before Cycle 1 Day 28, therefore no data presented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Clinical Benefit Response (CBR) Based on the Extramural Review Committee Assessment in Recommended Dose Group
outcome.description: Clinical Benefit Response is defined as sum of subjects confirmed with complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD)>= 22 weeks on study according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: SU-011248 50-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

class.title: Total Number of Subjects with CR+PR+SD>=22weeks

analysis.estimate_desc: The clinical benefit response (CBR) rate, defined as the percentage of the subjects confirmed with CR, PR, or SD>=22 weeks on study according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST).

outcome.title: Time To Failure (TTF)
outcome.description: Time To Failure (TTF) is defined as the time from the date of first dose of study treatment to the date of the first documentation of Progressive Disease (PD), the date of treatment discontinuation except completion of treatment, or date of death due to cancer.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose to Progressive Disease, Treatment discontinuation except completion of treatment, or Death due to cancer.
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: SU-011248 50-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. Treatment cycles were 6 weeks in duration, consisting of 4 weeks daily SU-011248 administration followed by 2 weeks off treatment. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

measure.title: Time To Failure (TTF)
measure.description: Time To Failure (TTF) is defined as the time from the date of first dose of study treatment to the date of the first documentation of Progressive Disease (PD), the date of treatment discontinuation except completion of treatment, or date of death due to cancer.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Overall Survival Time
outcome.description: Overall Survival Time is defined as the time from the date of first dose of study treatment to the date of the death due to any cause. For subjects whose death had not been confirmed, Overall Survival Time was censored on the last date when the patient was known to be alive. Survival was surveyed once a year from the registration day of the first subject, for all the subjects who received the study drug at least once.
outcome.time_frame: From the first dose to death
outcome.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: SU-011248 50-mg
group.description: Subjects received sunitinib malate (SU-011248) at starting dose of 50-mg once daily. Phase 1: If Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLT) was observed, the patients were withdrawn from the study treatment. Neither temporary discontinuation nor reduction was permitted. Phase 2: Treatment cycles were repeated until a study treatment withdrawal criterion was met. If drug-related adverse event (grade>=3) was observed, temporary discontinuation or dose reduction were taken according to the criteria. From Phase 1 part of this study, 50-mg was determined as the maximum tolerated dose and the recommended dose.

measure.title: Overall Survival Time
measure.description: Overall Survival Time is defined as the time from the date of first dose of study treatment to the date of the death due to any cause. For subjects whose death had not been confirmed, Overall Survival Time was censored on the last date when the patient was known to be alive. Survival was surveyed once a year from the registration day of the first subject, for all the subjects who received the study drug at least once.
measure.population: Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population defined as all subjects enrolled in study that receive at least 1 dose of study medication.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
